intro: Hieracium angustatum subsp. drimyodon, commonly known as the narrowleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its wetland or semi-wet environments.
